lines.content: A Java-based task management application via CLI.
Kiwee helps you manage your todos, deadlines, and events through a command-line interface (CLI) - all while providing
witty commentary on your productivity. It is developed as part of the CS2113 Individual Project (iP) at NUS.
Please see the [User Guide](docs/README.md) for detailed instructions on how to install and use Kiwee.
Kiwee is a **command-line task management application** that helps you organize your tasks efficiently.
1. Ensure you have Java 17 or above installed in your computer
6. You'll see Kiwee's welcome message and can start using commands!
Add simple tasks without any time constraints.
Another one? Fine... I've added this task:
Your list now has 1 tasks. Good luck surviving that.
Add tasks with a specific due date.
Another one? Fine... I've added this task:
Your list now has 2 tasks. Good luck surviving that.
Add tasks that occur during a specific time period.
Another one? Fine... I've added this task:
Added: [E][ ] Team meeting (from: Oct 03 2025, 2:00pm to: Oct 03 2025, 3:00pm)
Your list now has 3 tasks. Good luck surviving that.
View all your tasks at once.
Mark a completed task as not done.
How did you manage to do reverse work??
Remove a task from your list permanently.
Deleted. Because pretending it never existed totally helps productivity.
You have 2 tasks in your list
Search for tasks containing specific keywords.
Save your tasks and exit Kiwee.
Bye! Kiwee hopes you're leaving to actually finish your
- Your tasks are automatically saved to `./data/Kiwee.txt`
- The file is created automatically when you first run the application
- Tasks are loaded when you start Kiwee and saved when you exit
- If the data file is corrupted, Kiwee will skip invalid entries and continue loading valid tasks

* Command for adding a deadline task to the task list.
* Creates a new AddDeadlineCommand with the specified user input.
* @param input The user input containing the deadline description and due date
* Builds a Deadline task from the user input.
* Parses the input to extract the description and due date, then creates a new Deadline task.
* @throws KiweeException        If the input is empty
* @throws KiweeCommandException If required keyword "/by" is missing, description is empty, or due date is empty
throw new KiweeException("That's not a deadline, that's silence. Say something!");
throw new KiweeCommandException("Missing '/by' - deadlines need dates, not vibes.");
throw new KiweeCommandException("Describe the task, please. Kiwee can’t read minds (yet).");
throw new KiweeCommandException("When is it due? Stop procrastinating!!");
* Indicates whether this command should exit the application.
* @return false, as adding a deadline does not exit the application
* Command for adding an event task to the task list.
* Creates a new AddEventCommand with the specified user input.
* @param input The user input containing the event description, start date and end date
* Builds an Event task from the user input.
* @throws KiweeException          If the input is empty
* @throws KiweeCommandException   If required keywords "/from", "/to" or description are missing
* @throws EndBeforeStartException If the end time is before the start time
throw new KiweeException("That's not an event, that's silence. Say something!");
throw new KiweeCommandException("Missing '/from' - Kiwee can't guess when your event starts (yet).");
throw new KiweeCommandException("You forgot the description. Is this the mysterious unnamed event?");
throw new KiweeCommandException("Missing '/to' - Is this event endless????");
throw new KiweeCommandException("Both start and end must be provided. Time travel isn't supported yet.");

* Exception thrown when attempting to mark a task as done that is already marked as done.
* This prevents users from repeatedly marking the same task as completed.
* Creates a new AlreadyMarkedException with a message about the already completed task.
* @param task The task that was already marked as done
super("You've completed this task... again. Want a medal? \n" + Ui.SPACE + task);
* Exception thrown when attempting to unmark a task as not done that is already marked as not done.
* This prevents users from repeatedly marking the same task as incomplete.
* Creates a new AlreadyUnmarkedException with a message about the already incomplete task.
* @param task The task that was already marked as not done
super("Pro gamer move detected - unmarking what was never marked. \n" + Ui.SPACE + task);
* Exception thrown when attempting to read a data file that cannot be interpreted.
* This occurs when the stored data format is corrupted or invalid.
* Creates a new CorruptedLineException with a message about the corrupted data.
* @param message The corrupted data line that could not be interpreted
* Exception thrown when user sets an Event task's end time before its start time.
* This prevents users from inputting data that doesn't make logical sense.
* Creates a new EndBeforeStartException with a message about the invalid time ordering.
super("Wow! You finish your task before you started!");
* Exception thrown when user inputs an invalid index for a Task.
* This prevents the program from accessing invalid memory addresses or array indices.
* Creates a new InvalidTaskException with a message about the invalid index.
* @param index The index which the user tried to access
super("Task #" + index + " does not exist \n" + Ui.SPACE +
* Exception thrown when user inputs an invalid or unrecognized command.
* This provides helpful feedback and displays available commands to the user.
* Creates a new KiweeCommandException with a custom error message.
* The exception displays the error message along with available commands.
* @param message The error message describing the invalid command
+ Ui.SPACE + "Looks like someone forgot the rules \n\n"
* Base exception class for all Kiwee application-specific exceptions.
* Creates a new KiweeException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message describing what went wrong
* Exception thrown when user inputs an invalid or unrecognized date format.
* This provides helpful feedback and displays the accepted date formats to the user.
* Creates a new WrongDateFormatException with a message about the invalid date format
* and provides the accepted date formats to help the user.
super("Kiwee tried to read your date, but I broke my brain \n"
+ Ui.SPACE + "Use yyyy-MM-dd, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm, or HH:mm");
* A Deadline task has a description, completion status and due date.
* Creates a new Deadline task with the specified description and due date.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the deadline task
* @param by          The due date of the deadline task
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.
* The format is "[D]" followed by the status icon, description and due date.
* @return A string in the format "[D][status] description (by: due_date)"
* Returns a String representation to be stored in data file.
* where completion_status is "1" if done and "0" if not done.
* @return A string in the format "D|0|description|due_date" or "D|1|description|due_date"
* An Event task has a description, completion status, start time and end time.
* Creates a new Event task with the specified description, start time and end time.
* The task is initially marked as not done.

* @param from        The start time of the event task
* @param to          The end time of the event task

* Returns a String representation to be stored in data file.
